history.content:
Yes.
I confirmed that with the community  college which fully articulates to Berkeley that I will be allowed to take the course even though I had taken a similar course in a college which does not fully articulate.
As far as summer courses are concerned you are allowed to take anywhere you choose whatever course you want.
So even though I researched the above route  I did not pursue it and instead am taking 47B (1 unit course) in upcoming Spring 2022.

Edits
----------
Here is the link for 47B .
https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2022-spring-compsci-47b-001-slf-001 
It has seats and you can join even now.
You just need to finish the projects and it is self paced. No homework , no exams, no lectures to attend.
On a side note I am taking 47B/CS70/Data C100 in Spring 2022, in case you have further questions you can always email me.

children.subject: I think there might be 2 projects. But considering it is 1 unit course I am not 100% sure.
That CS 47B bridge course also sounds like a good option. Do you have any idea how many projects we have to complete in that course?

history.content:
Hello,

I'm a transfer student intending to CS through the College of L&S. This Spring semester I'll be taking CS 61A and CS 70. Before transferringto Berkeley, I took a data structure course at my CC that is not fully articulated to CS 61B at Berkeley. However, I  just recently discovered that there's a community college in the Bay Area that offers a course that is fully articulated to CS 61B. Will I be allowed to enroll in that course during the summer to satisfy the requirement for CS 61B? I'm fully aware that the grade I get in that class will not be calculated to the GPA requirement to declare CS. However, it seems to be a more affordable option for me to take it during Summer session.
history.subject: Possibility for a Transfer Student to Take Equivalent of CS 61B during Summer
